user_context_message_data.about_user_message:
About Myself: I have a very high level of mathematical knowledge up to the post-graduate level. 

These are my main areas of interest:
(1) coding: mainly Python
(2) mathematics up to graduate level and research level
(3) machine learning and artificial intelligence

parts:
Help me design a 10-week study programme covering the following competencies in programming and code design:

- Intermediate programming experience in one of these languages: Python, R, Scala, Java, C, C++, C#, Go.
- Understand basic data pre-processing (handling missing data, outliers etc…)
- Able to build machine learning models
- Able to build data pipelines to train and build your models
- Able to perform basic code documentation (Readme, docstrings and requirements.txt)
- Able to deploy your models in Docker containers
- Able to provision and use cloud computing infrastructure such as Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure or AWS.
- Able to do Linux shell scripting
- Able to use at least one of the following databases and data processing technologies such as SQL, NoSQL, Apache Hadoop and/or Apache Spark
- Able to use GitHub/GitLab and perform proper code check-in/out and repository

Designing a 10-week study program to cover the competencies you've outlined is an ambitious but achievable task. To ensure thorough learning, we'll organize the program into a week-by-week format, focusing on one or two competencies at a time, using Python as the primary programming language due to its versatility and widespread use in data science and machine learning.

### Week 1-2: Intermediate Python Programming
- **Topics Covered**: Advanced data structures, OOP in Python, exception handling, working with libraries.
- **Activities**: Daily coding exercises, completing a small project using these concepts.
- **Resources**: "Fluent Python" by Luciano Ramalho, Python documentation.

### Week 3-4: Data Pre-processing and Basic Machine Learning
- **Topics Covered**: Handling missing data, data normalization, outlier detection. Introduction to scikit-learn.
- **Activities**: Implement pre-processing pipelines, build basic regression and classification models.
- **Resources**: scikit-learn documentation, "Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow" by Aurélien Géron.

### Week 5: Building and Documenting Data Pipelines
- **Topics Covered**: Creating data pipelines using Pandas and scikit-learn, basic code documentation including READMEs, docstrings, and requirements.txt.
- **Activities**: Develop a data pipeline for a dataset, document the code.
- **Resources**: Pandas documentation, Sphinx for generating documentation.

### Week 6: Docker and Model Deployment
- **Topics Covered**: Introduction to Docker, containerizing machine learning models.
- **Activities**: Dockerize a simple machine learning model, understand Docker Compose.
- **Resources**: Docker documentation, online tutorials.

### Week 7: Cloud Computing Infrastructure
- **Topics Covered**: Basics of AWS, setting up compute instances, storage, and using S3.
- **Activities**: Deploy a model in AWS EC2, use S3 for data storage.
- **Resources**: AWS tutorials, Coursera or A Cloud Guru courses.

### Week 8: Linux Shell Scripting
- **Topics Covered**: Basic shell commands, writing shell scripts, cron jobs.
- **Activities**: Write scripts to automate model training and deployment.
- **Resources**: "The Linux Command Line" by William Shotts.

### Week 9: Databases and Data Processing Technologies
- **Topics Covered**: SQL basics, introduction to NoSQL databases, overview of Hadoop and Spark.
- **Activities**: Perform data queries, set up a simple NoSQL database, run basic Spark jobs.
- **Resources**: Apache official documentation, online tutorials.

### Week 10: Git and Version Control
- **Topics Covered**: Using Git for version control, branching, merging, pull requests.
- **Activities**: Set up a GitLab repository, manage a multi-contributor project.
- **Resources**: "Pro Git" by Scott Chacon and Ben Straub, Git documentation.

### Weekly Structure
- **Monday**: Introduction to weekly topics through readings and tutorials.
- **Tuesday-Thursday**: Practical exercises and mini-projects.
- **Friday**: Review and reflection on the week's learnings and preparation for next week.
- **Weekend**: Rest or catch-up on any outstanding work, optional advanced challenges.

### Additional Tips
- **Pair Learning**: Whenever possible, pair up with a peer to tackle projects and debug together.
- **Community Engagement**: Participate in forums and discussions (like Stack Overflow, Reddit's r/learnprogramming) to expose yourself to different problems and solutions.
- **Regular Reviews**: At the end of each week, review your progress and adjust the upcoming week's plan if needed based on your understanding and comfort level with the topics.

This structure not only helps in understanding theoretical aspects but also provides ample practical experience which is crucial in programming and development fields.
Please extend the above programme duration to 14 weeks

Extending the program to 14 weeks allows for a more in-depth exploration of each topic, additional time for practical projects, and the incorporation of some advanced topics. Here's an adjusted plan:

### Week 1-2: Intermediate Python Programming
- **Extended Activities**: Include more complex Python projects that incorporate APIs and web scraping.
- **Resources**: "Automate the Boring Stuff with Python" by Al Sweigart for web scraping.

### Week 3-4: Data Pre-processing and Basic Machine Learning
- **Extended Activities**: In-depth case studies on data pre-processing in different industries.
- **Resources**: Case studies from Kaggle.

### Week 5-6: Building and Documenting Data Pipelines
- **Extended Topics**: Advanced data transformations and automated data pipeline testing.
- **Activities**: Build a robust data pipeline for a complex dataset, include unit tests.

### Week 7-8: Docker and Model Deployment
- **Extended Topics**: Introduction to Kubernetes for managing containerized applications.
- **Activities**: Set up a Kubernetes cluster and deploy multiple containers.

### Week 9-10: Cloud Computing Infrastructure
- **Extended Topics**: Explore additional services like AWS Lambda for serverless computing and Amazon SageMaker for ML deployment.
- **Activities**: Deploy a serverless application using AWS Lambda.

### Week 11: Linux Shell Scripting
- **Extended Topics**: Advanced scripting including sed, awk, and regular expressions.
- **Activities**: Automate more complex system tasks using scripts.

### Week 12: Databases and Data Processing Technologies
- **Extended Topics**: Deep dive into performance tuning in SQL and real-time data processing with Apache Spark.
- **Activities**: Optimize database queries and set up a mini real-time data processing job using Spark Streaming.

### Week 13-14: Git and Version Control, and Final Projects
- **Week 13**: Advanced Git techniques, including rebasing, resolving conflicts, and using advanced Git tools like Git Hooks.
- **Activities**: Simulate a team project environment with complex version control scenarios.
- **Week 14**: Final projects where learners choose a topic covered in the program to develop a comprehensive application or solution, demonstrating all they have learned.
- **Activities**: Planning, coding, documenting, and presenting the final project.

### Additional Week Structure Adjustments
- **Mentorship and Peer Reviews**: Introduce bi-weekly mentorship sessions where learners can discuss challenges with a mentor. Peer reviews on Fridays can help learners receive feedback and learn from each other.
- **Weekly Challenges**: Incorporate a weekly challenge related to the week’s topic to foster problem-solving skills and innovation.

This revised schedule not only covers more ground but also provides flexibility to delve deeper into complex topics, ensuring a more comprehensive understanding and better preparation for real-world applications.
